questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A company requires a data traffic policy that uses the “mpls” and “biz-internet” colors for Google Apps if the SLA is met. A link with the “public-internet” color must be used if the other two links violate the data SLA. Which configuration meets these requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is the only option.

Option B and D have only 1 difference. It's Strict menu which was selected. In vManage 20.9 version there's Strict/Drop menu (not Strict). If you are selecting this menu there's no way to select Backup SLA Preferred Color. So I'll go with B.

The desired actions are entirely for Google, so all of the references to Microsoft are wrong. Answer B is exactly how Google should be configured. All other answers have errors. I can only assume that the Google/Microsoft mismatch is a typo or mistake in the question.
Option B, restrict is not an option when there is preferred backup color

comments.content: The conditions are defined in the SLA class. In this case, it is named Data_SLA. Having Google in the question and Microsoft in the answers is presumably a typo. Otherwise all the answers would be wrong.

discussion.content: there is no mention of MS apps in the question only google apps - what conditions

Option [A]

The match conditions for MS Apps is directed towards the public-internet as requested.

comments.content: My wording is slightly off. The "preferred colors" are the colors to use if those colors meet the SLA. The "backup preferred colors" are to be used if no colors meet the SLA. Both parameters are needed, as is the SLA class which defines what the SLA requirements are that are being checked.
A and B both have the "backup" action configured correctly, but A is missing the SLA class and the preferred colors for SLA-compliant traffic. The "backup" command is for the non-compliant traffic.

choices.A: Customers add custom application ports in vAnalytics and vSmart.
choices.D: Cisco adds custom application ports in vAnalytics and vSmart.
choices.C: Customers add custom application ports in vAnalytics and vManage.
choices.B: Cisco adds custom application ports in vAnalytis and vManage.

questions.question_text: How are custom application ports monitored in Cisco SD-WAN controllers?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
IMO -option C is the right one.

Option [C] is the Answer

Custom Application Ports Created in VManage is activated immediately for application visibility functionality only (Monitoring Traffic).

Cisco white paper Link:-
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/policies/vedge-20-x/policies-book/m-custom-applications.pdf

questions.question_text:
An engineer modifies a data policy for DIA in VPN 200 to meet the requirements for traffic destined to these locations:
• external networks; must be translated
• external networks; must use a public TLOC color
• syslog servers, must use a private TLOC color

Here is the existing data policy configuration:

//IMG//


Which policy configuration sequence set meets the requirements?

discussion.content:
These are not a serious questions for CERT to verify your knowledge . 
It's more like they wanna catch you on stupid details. 
I regret I submitted for this cisco CERT exam. 
This will be my last cisco CERT exam a undertake and I swear I don't continue further on these cisco "games".
I passed ~6 cisco exams so far in 13 years , but this the most ridiculous bunch of questions and answers I have met yet.

comments.content:
How its C when it uses sequence 20 ????
Its already used on the original config
Only way C to be correct is that we will modify the sequence 20.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The answer A is NOT correct because of the sequence numbers. These are higher and will never match the requirements. the correct answer is C

comments.content:
The formatting is not very well presented and after further inspection I can see the public color of biz-internet within answer [C]

The nat use-vpn 0 command is for DIA
Therefore the answer is option [C]
so we can use same sequence twice?
seq 20 is overlapping in option C, it seens like D is correct, syslog needs to go via MPLS

For me is C also , but, when I read "external networks must be translated" i am thinking to translate them , so nat in a some way, so NAT VPN 0, then in the C we are not indicating that, but i am in my mind thinking that's a policy in cli, so i am replacing and the nat VPN 0 is being keeped, because if not we are not translating. Anyway C is the good answer for me. You should match Syslog servers before for sure, because if not 0.0.0.0/0 will match all your traffic before any kind of match. Always from particular to global, like acls, route maps ,etc. Thanks for sharing

discussion.content:
The existing policy defines the first request "external networks must be translated"
*match desination-ip 0.0.0.0/0* 
*nat use-vpn 0*

(External Networks must use a public TLOC color)
*match destination-ip 0.0.0.0/0* 
*set local-tloc-list color biz-internet* - (Public TLOC Color)

(syslog servers, must use a private TLOC color)
*match destination-data-prefix-list SYSLOG-SERVERS*
*set local-tloc-list color MPLS* (Private TLOC Color)

The sequence are set in an ordered structure, consisting of match and action conditions, 
in which data traffic is analysed! If a route does not match any of the conditions in a route, 
it is rejected by default!

Option [A] fulfils the request and follows the ordered sequence of paired match and action conditions!

questions.question_text: Which storage format is used when vManage is deployed as a virtual machine on a KVM hypervisor?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
KVM fiile has qcow2 extension

Option [D]
qcow2 is the storage format recognized by the VManage KVM Hypervisor.

Link Reference
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/sdwan-xe-gs-book/cisco-sd-wan-overlay-network-bringup.html
AC is the correct answer since it should be local policy

D AND E.

I am on vmanage on live and add QoS map is not permitting to rewrite DSCP, is only related to define the BW , buffer, burst ,Scheduling type, drop type and forwarding class.

D is permitting it , and also E (but i am agree that the question was saying the edge router, so, it seems not globaly, but , like QOS MAP it not permitting it, then D and E for me.)

Selected Answer: CD
C, D, and E can all do this with Data policies, but the question says configure the Edge Router, so it has to be a Localized policy, eliminating E.
[A] & [C] is correct due to being a localized specific policy!

comments.content: mmmm As Zamochit say, QoS Map only permit to define the BW , buffer, burst ,Scheduling type, drop type and forwarding class. D and E it seems correct.

route policy is a control policy not data so it won't do affect qos in any way. 
It is C and D

Please disregard the above, a rare oversight on my behalf, after further coverage, the answers are [C] & [D]

Credit to @menna_nasr16 on the validity!

Reference:-
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/qos/ios-xe-17/qos-book-xe/forwarding-qos.html#c_Forwarding_and_QoS_Overview_12257.xml

questions.question_text: An engineer must configure the SD-WAN Edge router to identify DSCP 26 traffic coming from the router’s local site and then change the DSCP value to DSCP 18 before sending it over to the SD-WAN fabric. What are the two ways to create the required configuration? (Choose two.)
